title: Manchester United Zidane Iqbal completes FC Utrecht transfer
body_text:
Manchester United midfielder Zidane Iqbal has completed a permanent transfer to Dutch side FC Utrecht.
The Athletic reported last week that United will receive a fee of up to €1million (£857k; $1.09m) for Iqbal, who has signed a four-year deal with Utrecht.
The 20-year-old Iraq international announced his exit from Old Trafford with a social media post last week which read: “The academy is a special place that makes dreams come true for so many. That was certainly the case for me.
Advertisement
“I will never forget standing on the touchline of Old Trafford waiting to come on for my debut. That feeling of pride will live with me forever.
“The time is right to go and take on a new challenge. It is one that I cannot wait for and I cannot wait to get started.
“I will always be a United fan and I will always love this football club.”
Manchester-born Iqbal came through the United academy and signed his first professional contract in April 2021.
He made his first-team debut later that year as a late substitute in a Champions League match against Young Boys.
Despite being named in the matchday squad on 17 occasions in the 2022-23 season, Iqbal did not make a first-teamappearance under Erik ten Hag.
Utrecht finished seventh in last season’s Eredivisie.
